attributes.action: Make it law for all horse riders to wear hi-viz clothing when riding on the road
attributes.background:
As a horse rider, nothing infuriates me more than other riders who risk themselves and their horses by hacking on roads not wearing hi-viz. 
We expect drivers and other road users to slow down when passing us so we should make sure we can be seen well in advance.
attributes.additional_details:
Wearing hi-viz increases visibility by seconds. 
By not wearing it riders increase the risk of accident.

Be safe, be seen!

attributes.action: Candidates for positions of power must declare all associations to Organizations
attributes.background: When we have elections for Police Commissioners, MPs, Mayors etc, we should have the right to know what organizations the candidate are a member of so we can make a more informed choice.
attributes.additional_details: More and more positions of power within the Police, Army, Government & finance appear to being held by people who don't seem to represent the best interests of the people, this is one way of giving people more choice of who they want to represent them. We should be informed so that we can choose between people who put the interests of the people first or the interests of an Organization (secret or otherwise) causing a conflict of interest. Any person who fails to declare association with any society, Party or Organization (secret or Open)  should be removed from the position they hold

attributes.action: Put and end to UK circuses using animals as part of their 'performances'.
attributes.background: Along with you I feel it is extremely necessary to put an end to the abusive, cruel and unorthodox ways in which animals are treated in order to 'perform' to an audience. Awareness for this issue is preposterously inadequate and a lot more action against this compulsory to make a difference.
attributes.additional_details:
One case study to get a taste of the happens that are kept away from the public is Anne the elephant: 

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1370050/Britains-circus-elephant-Anne-Battered-kicked-stabbed.html 

These animals are put through a life of pain for a number of hours worth of entertainment, surely everybody can see the imbalance in this.

attributes.action: Independent review on which voting system delivers the greatest representation.
attributes.background: The current First Past the Post voting system is delivering Governments voted for by the largest minority of voters, not the majority, but there are disagreements over which system would deliver the greatest representation, AV. AV+, STV, PR. An independent review is needed to answer this question.
attributes.additional_details:
More information on the different types of voting systems can be found on the internet, once site being
http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/voting-systems
Many other Countries use different systems, Scotland uses the STV system for its local elections.

attributes.action: The U.K. Gov to make it illegal to fly the ISIS (Daesh) flag in the U.K.
attributes.background: ISIS, ISIL or Daesh is a terrorist organisation. The flying if their flag in the UK needs to be made a criminal offence punishable by prison, or deportation, as it encourages terrorism and terrorist sympathy.
attributes.additional_details:
ISIS, ISIL or Daesh is a terrorist organisation. Their flag has been flown in the UK often and should be made illegal. Anyone caught with the flag should be considered a terrorist threat, be immediately arrested as such, and be fully investigated, along with their family and friends for terrorist activities. 

The punishment for flying the flag in public, or being caught with the flag in their home, should be a heavy prison sentance, or deportation.

attributes.action: Make all anti-depressants free on the NHS
attributes.background: Anti-depressant tablets are needed by a large proportion of the U.K population - why should people have to pay for these when they desperately need them. Mental illnesses should be treated the same way as physical: in the way that for example Thyroid tablets are free, anti-depressants should be.

attributes.action: Allow NON-EU parents/ family members of British Citizens to settle in UK.
attributes.background:
Following my dad's terminal illness, my family (I, my wife & son) relocated to India in 2014 to look after my dad & support my mum.
Since I have lost my dad, we want to return home (London) but I can't leave my elderly mum (who has already gone through a lot since 2012) on her own in India.
attributes.additional_details:
I, my wife & son are UK Citizens. We own a house in London & had decent jobs in financial service industry until we moved our center of life to India in Apr'14.
Following my dad's demise, I'm desperate to return to our home in London but are forced to stay in India as UK won't let my mum in to settle & I can't leave her alone!  UK allows non EU family of EU immigrants under EU law but can't do the same for it's own citizens. Is this the price we have to pay for being UK citizens & tax payers?

attributes.action: Restore the small profits rate of Corporation Tax at 15% for profits to £300,000
attributes.background:
Since the 2011-12 tax year, the small profits rate of Corporation Tax has been eroded to zero.

In these uncertain economic times, we ask the government to support small businesses by restoring the small profits rate of Corporation Tax at 15% and locking this rate at 5% lower than the main rate.
attributes.additional_details:
In the 2011-12 tax year, the main rate of Corporation Tax was 26% against the small profits rate of 20% for businesses with profits of up to £300,000.

Since then, the main rate has been steadily reduced with no comparable reduction in the small profits rate.  

As a result, since April 2015, there has been a harmonized Corporation Tax rate of 20%.

attributes.action: Allow tax-paying UK residents to vote in general elections and referendums
attributes.background:
Excluding tax paying immigrants from the voting population makes the vote less representative of the will of the UK because it silences a very important part of the engine of the country.
Let's make sure going forward all the people who love and work hard for this country have a say in its future.

attributes.action: Do not trigger Article 50 until second EU referendum.
attributes.background: The current divide following 1st EU referendum means that the population is not represented at all, and the campaign was based on misleading information.

attributes.action: Stop fracking exploration in Teesside, revoke licenses granted to Third Energy
attributes.background: Third Energy has recently been granted permission to explore for shale gas in and around the Teesside area. The areas they have been granted are heavily populated and also nature reserves and fracking would destroy these areas of beauty.

attributes.action: Better pay for support workers and carers they are the backbone of this country.
attributes.background: Carers, supported living and especially nursing homes, are the backbone of this country. Right now, the care sector and social welfare sector is suffering to the point of collapse. It is the backbone of this country. In order to attract a quality of care, the rate of pay MUST be increased.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/social-care-network/2015/jan/20/care-workers-better-pay-conditions

This article in the guardian more or less sums up the whole situation. 

If we are to attract a quality of staff that is prepared to actually "care" then we must give those staff the incentive to come and do so. Right now, the wage is slow low it is almost in design to attract abuse, negativity and bad care. And those who do care are pushed to their limit financially and emotionally. This must change.

attributes.action: Say no to the single market and 7 year immigration brake, leave means leave.
attributes.background: Brexit, leave means leave say no to the single market and say no to the 7 year immigration brake, after 7 years we would be back to square one.

attributes.action: Reconsider changing bursaries to loans for Student Nurses and Midwives.
attributes.background: The government has recently voted to remove the NHS Bursary for Student Nurses and Midwives. Student Nurses and midwives work 37.5 per hours a week on placement, they should not have to pay for the privilege of becoming nurses, when they already work for that money!

attributes.action: Make voting compulsory in elections and referendums, similar to Australian law.
attributes.background: Voters are obliged to vote in elections or attend a poling station, or log a postal vote, if they do not they could be subject to a penalty, such as fines or community service. Currently there are 22 countries, including Australia, that have this system.

attributes.action: Implement Mandatory Licensing For Estate Agents
attributes.background:
How can an industry that deals with the most valuable asset that their customers own, not be regulated by licensing as other industries are?

Complaints against estate agents are up 32% with a record £800,000 being paid out in compensation to home buyers, sellers and tenants (Oct 2016, TPOS).
attributes.additional_details: https://www.tpos.co.uk/news-media-and-press-releases/reports

attributes.action: Stop children convicted of serious offences from attending mainstream schools
attributes.background: The current legislative framework MUST be reviewed to ensure those committing the most serious offences such as stabbing another child cannot return to mainstream school, putting the safety of children & teachers at risk
attributes.additional_details: There MUST be a minimum period of monitoring and psychological assessment within a specialist unit before offenders are reintegrated, irrespective of the number of previous exclusions a child has.  Disruptive behaviour currently carries the same punishment as stabbing.

attributes.action: Raise the student maintenance loan in Cambridge to match the London living costs
attributes.background: Living costs in Cambridge have considerably increased in the past 3 years. Yet, the loans given to students do not reflect this increase in the same way as they do for London students. The average rent for student accommodation in Cambridge is so high that currently loans do not cover the majority.

attributes.action: Extend the timetable for district councils to submit their Local plans
attributes.background: Plans based their housing numbers on several factors (migration, economic growth, etc). The data supporting these factors may no longer be valid given the significant risks that have emerged post BREXIT. Councils should be required to review the risks and reconfirm their housing requirements.

attributes.action: Ban politicians from office who lie or deliberately/knowingly deceive the public
attributes.background: Recently there has been considerable deception on the part of politicians who appear to have deliberately deceived the British public on matters affecting the future well-being of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: A politician shown to have seriously lied or deliberately or knowingly deceived the public on important matters of national interest should be barred from holding any ministerial post in government.

attributes.action: In a 2nd independence referendum, Scots living outside Scotland will get a vote
attributes.background: The recent referendum on EU membership may now precipitate a 2nd Scottish independence referendum.  If the Scottish Government takes this step, then it is reasonable that Scottish-born people currently living outside of Scotland have a vote in such a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Scottish-born people, whether they are currently living in England or elsewhere, will be affected by the result of such a referendum, as it will have serious and life-changing implications for their future choice of nationality, citizenship and passport etc., both for themselves and for their descendants.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to display a halal food sign in businesses serving halal food.
attributes.background: All businesses serving halal food should clearly display a sign at the entrance of their establishment stating that the food they serve is halal. This would allow people of the Muslim faith to clearly identify where they are permitted to eat and Sikhs to identify where they cannot eat.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke in front of children, or in rooms which they use
attributes.background: Adults who smoke in front of children, especially inside a house are neglecting the health of that child. Smoke also hangs around on furniture / walls / curtains, making it an unhealthy environment for the child. Smoking in front of a child should be illegal and deemed as child neglect

attributes.action: Stronger penalties and punishments for bullies in school
attributes.background: Recently more and more children are being bullied and the incident is being posted on social media we need to show this is wrong and have stronger penalties and punishment for such behaviour to deter other people from doing it and show them this type of behaviour is unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details: boy 11 died due to bullying 29.9.16

attributes.action: Require the Department of Health to review outdated (1988) Child Growth Chart
attributes.background: Infants and Children's weight in the UK is measured on an outdated growth chart formulated in 1988 based on formula fed babies and children in 1988. This is wrongly leading to children and babies being "labelled" as obese from birth.
attributes.additional_details:
I am calling for this petition as today my health visitor advised me that my child who was born just above the 75th centile for weight and above the 98th centile for height is "overweight".  (Despite being breastfed on demand for 16 months of his life, as per best advice to breastfeed for the first year.)
Despite this the Health Visitor tells me that at any contact with a health professional we are likely to be advised about regulating his weight.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory at all schools to have a time dedicated for napping.
attributes.background: A recent NASA study revealed that a 20 minute nap boosted cognition by almost 40%. Therefore in order for a students to fully focus throughout their school day the government should urge schools to set apart a time of day for sleep. Schools could provide dark rooms or pods for sleep only.

attributes.action: Enforce tougher penalties for mobile phone use while driving.
attributes.background: While driving around the country with work, I witness far too many drivers all over the road because they are using their mobile phones, mainly in their hands, while driving. This is mostly texting or typing. The current fine and penalty points are far too low and the penalty must be higher.
attributes.additional_details:
Drivers who text on the road are in far more danger than intoxicated drivers.

A Techtimes study results show those who occupied themselves with text messages, either by reading or writing them, had slower reactions times by 35%. By comparison, drunk drivers displayed a 12% decrease in reaction time, while drivers intoxicated with cannabis had slowed response times by 21%. http://www.techtimes.com/articles/8185/20140609/texting-is-more-dangerous-than-drugs-alcohol-while-driving-study.htm

attributes.action: Stop the production of the 1 pence coins.
attributes.background:
The rate of inflation has made 1 pence coins virtually unusable. 
Canada has already removed its lowest value currency from circulation.
If the cost to produce one Canadian Penny is 1.5 Canadian Cents, then we can assume it has a similar cost in the UK.
It is uneconomical to keep in circulation.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/cost_to_produce_one_penny

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-21292441

attributes.action: Petition to finally shut down Dogs4Us and eradicate all puppy farming.
attributes.background: Puppy farming is still rife in the country and as a result thousands of animals are inhumanely treated and forced to breed. Millions of families receive animals who are in poor health and have numerous defects. Sadly many of these animals come from organisations like Dogs4Us. Lets stop this now.
attributes.additional_details: Dogs4Us has been exposed by numerous reputable news outlets yet the suffering still continuous. Together we can stop this abuse and shut down places like dogs4us as well as banning the act of puppy farming once and for all.

attributes.action: A vote of no confidence in Boris Johnson as the UK's foreign secretary.
attributes.background: Boris Johnson has consistently demonstrated a lack of awareness towards Europe and the rest of the world. Why would we, citizens of the United Kingdom allow this man to represent us in Europe and the rest of the world as our foreign secretary?

attributes.action: Give the rest of the UK a referendum as to whether they wish Scotland to remain.
attributes.background: If Scotland decides on a 2nd referendum to leave or remain with the UK then the rest of the UK simultaneously should have a referendum as to whether they wish Scotland to remain. If EITHER referendum indicate that Scotland should leave then they must leave the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The future of the UK should be decided by all of the residents of the UK and not just a minority.

attributes.action: Bring back A-level resits!
attributes.background: We want to bring back A-level resits for alll students across the UK. We want to be able to make sure you can resit your AS year and/or A2 year. It will enable students to have access to a second opportunity and allow them to attend University instead of missing out on the chance to prevail in life.
attributes.additional_details: By bringing back the AS/A2 resits, students will have the opportunity to achieve their highest aspirations in life instead of being set back due to one bad grade.

attributes.action: Reinstate the personal tax allowance for people earning over £100,000 pa.
attributes.background: Tax system flaws leave professionals paying 60 per cent tax, yet those on higher income pay just 45%.
attributes.additional_details:
Above the £10,600 tax-free personal allowance there are three bands of income tax people pay on earnings: 20pc (basic rate - from £10,600), 40pc (higher rate - from £42,385) and 45pc (additional rate - from £150,000). 

But people earning over £100,000 gradually have their personal allowance removed at a rate of £1 for every £2 earned above the threshold, up to £121,200. This means a "fourth" band of "marginal tax" is created in which they pay 60pc on income in between these levels, plus 2pc for national insurance, a total rate of 62pc. 
Workers pocket just 38pc of the income they earn between these levels. It means, ludicrously, that they pay a higher marginal tax rate than people who earn far more.

attributes.action: Make 12 November 2018 a Bank Holiday to commemorate 100 yrs since the Great War.
attributes.background: Over 1.1 million Service men and women lost their lives in the Great War. We invite you to create a dedication to each and every one of them and celebrate what they achieved. This day will be devoted to the remembrance of the fallen and to support charities across the UK dedicated to this cause.

attributes.action: Ensure  the UK can trade tariff free in the EU single market after Brexit
attributes.background: It is vital for jobs and UK prosperity that the UK does not cut off the inportant markets of the EU to UK business after Brexit. Our Financial services are the backbone of our economy and must have full passporting rights going forward. The industrial sector too must not be penalised for Brexit

attributes.action: Regulate all Online Animal Rescue Groups
attributes.background: After a bad experience with an online animal rescue group, who illegally re-homed my cat, I learned of others who had difficulties with them. Animal suffering was also suggested. Anyone can set up an online rescue group; there are no premises; they need no licence; the RSPCA  find it hard to inspect
attributes.additional_details:
Animal Welfare legislation is out  of date:
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/animal-welfare-legislation-protecting-pets 
There is no legislation or governing body to check online rescue groups.
People need no prior animal rescue knowledge or experience to start a group. 
Immediately a group is set up they can ask for donations regardless of whether they are a registered charity or not. The groups are not accountable to anyone and nor are their financial records.
Many start off with good intent but cannot cope when they are inundated with animals and have a lack of funding.

attributes.action: Do not allow MP's  to veto the democratic vote  to leave the European Union.
attributes.background: The people of the U.K. By a majority voted to leave the European Union on June 23rd 2016 but some MP's believe that it is their right to ignore the electorate who made this decision. Therefore we the undersigned call on the government not allow a vote on this decision.
attributes.additional_details: In refusing the opportunity for MP's to be given this vote it must remembered that Government gave a commitment to referendum which it stood by and the electorate with a turnout of more than 70% voted to leave the EU. Therefore Brexit must mean Brexit.

attributes.action: Raise awareness and increase funding for Mental Health.
attributes.background: Mental Health is a significant issue in the UK. Around 25% of all UK citizens experience mental illness, and almost a third of children in education will experience it. It is a silent issue that many feel embarrassed to discuss. Our aim is to raise support for those who experience mental illness.
attributes.additional_details: We (National Citizen Service) are currently aiming to work in association with a charity called 'Mind' who are currently supporting around 375,000 people, which is drastically less than the 25% that come forward regarding their mental illness.

attributes.action: Introduce Politics into the Key Stage 3 & 4 curriculum
attributes.background: We believe that politics should be an evenly taught subject with the objective to inform learners of what policies the current government have in place and the effect these can have on the country. Also to avoid being mislead by any inaccurate advertising by any campaign.
attributes.additional_details: "£350 million a week goes to the EU, let's put that into the NHS" - Misleading to those without an understanding of what the £350 million actually goes on.

attributes.action: All plastic packaging produced by supermarkets must be made to be recyclable
attributes.background: There is an inordinate amount of plastic produced by supermarkets.  At least 50% of this shows that it is not recyclable. So much plastic is being put into bins and then into landfill. Individuals are responsible for recycling but given the opportunity to recycle more I think most will.

attributes.action: Hold an all-party public inquiry into bullying and harassment in Parliament
attributes.background:
Recent difficulties in relations between MP's in the Labour Party have highlighted an endemic culture of bullying within HoC.

Bullying & harassment aren't accepted in any other workplace or institution in the UK. This toxic culture is harming individuals and politics more widely.
attributes.additional_details:
MP reduced to tears watching personal attacks at Labour leader designed to "Break him as a man": http://tinyurl.com/zl268n5

Some of these MPs have since stated they felt extreme pressure to vote "no confidence" in the leader

Conservative MPs have spoken out against bullying behaviour and how ineffective current anti-bullying measures are: http://tinyurl.com/z8se6nz

We need

* Full inquiry into bullying into HoC
* Measures to bring protection for MPs and HoC staff in line with other workplaces

attributes.action: Stop making cuts to the NHS mental health service.
attributes.background:
More people have started suffering from mental health issues.
The majority are desperate for help, but when they reach out there is nothing there.
Suicide rates are increasing due to thinking there is no hope.
If the NHS keeps cutting funding for mental health support this will just get worse.

attributes.action: an amendment to the Weights and Measures Act 1985 to allow Pound and Ounces.
attributes.background:
We the undersigned would like to be able to buy and sell goods in Pounds and Ounces. All it would take is a small amendment to the Weights and Measures Act 1985 to allow us to buy and sell goods in Pound and Ounces.  



This is a Zider Party campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
To sell goods in pounds and ounces was made illegally by the weights and measures Act 1985.

All we ask is for a small amendment to the Weight and Measures Act 1985 to allow us to use pounds and ounces to buy and sells goods.

attributes.action: UK must reaffirm its commitment of sovereignty over Gibraltar after Brexit
attributes.background: With Spain renewing its claim of sovereignty over Gibraltar in a matter hours after the UK voted to leave the European Union, the UK Government must immediately reaffirm its commitment to Gibraltar .
attributes.additional_details:
The UK must a make a binding treaty with the European Union guaranteeing Gibraltar special status, which guarantees visa free cross-border movement for people and trade between Gibraltar and Spain. 

The UK government must grant Gibraltar their own dedicated MP in parliament 

The UK must re-establish our permanent Army and Royal Navy bases on Gibraltar to guarantee its future security.

attributes.action: All Public & Committee meetings in Council & Government should be Live-Streamed
attributes.background: To further the interests of transparency and openness, a presumption should be made to Live-Stream all meetings that affect people's lives, so no official or elected representative can hide behind anonymity and we, as citizens, will no longer be deceived or have communications  "spun".
attributes.additional_details: Where there is no risk of compromise to individuals or families, the presumption must be that all public or committee meetings should be live-streamed so citizens have less reason to distrust politicians or civil servants. If there is nothing to hide, there is nothing to fear is what we are told by government agencies concerned with surveillance and monitoring, so the same should apply to government. The United Kingdom should be a world leader in "glasnost" not forever in the shadows.

attributes.action: Ban all schools from using mini buses.
attributes.background:
Schools drive pupils/students around in mini buses on basic car licences.
Ban all schools from doing this unless they employ a qualified PCV licence holder with up to date CPC card.
attributes.additional_details:
If schools had to use coach companies it would create jobs and boost business.
All drivers are qualified and CRB checked so children would be safe still.

attributes.action: All businesses to have disabled access including a ramp and moving space inside.
attributes.background: A lot of small businesses don't have disabled access, preventing people (like my mother who was diagnosed with rheumatoid and osteoarthritis a few years back) entering shops. Some that do have a ramp to allow the disabled into the store don't have enough space to allow navigation around the store.
attributes.additional_details: Please help make it illegal for shops to not have disabled access (a ramp and enough space inside) as this prevents people, like my mother, entering shops whatsoever.

attributes.action: Instruct Royal Mail to change its opt-out scheme for junk mail to an opt-in one.
attributes.background: Royal Mail earns over £1.3 bn each year from junk mail deliveries. (It calls it "unaddressed mail"). It offers an opt-out service, but this does not work. An opt-in system would ensure that only those who wish to receive junk mail receive it.
attributes.additional_details: The opt-out system does not work: there is no confirmation of a successful application to opt-out; the opt-out only lasts for two years; there is no notification of the end date; and there is no invitation to renew the opt-out at the end of the two year period. In spite of all the hurdles put in place by Royal Mail, junk mail still gets delivered. The system in place does not work, so it needs to be changed.

attributes.action: Change the law all assets to be sold/split equally when a relationship ends.
attributes.background: Current law allows the parent remaining with the kids to remain in the family home till the youngest turns 18. Leaving the other parent potentially homeless. The law needs to change so that the when separation/divorce happens all assets should be sold/divided equally allowing both to move on
attributes.additional_details: I am currently living with family as I can not afford nor get help with housing. I share my kids so when I have them I rely on family to put me and my kids up. This is extremely unfair on all. I am not the first nor will I be the last to find myself in this situation. Most people will know of someone having the same issue as myself. Mediation/solicitors/court costs if the law was changed so that when a couple separate/divorce all assets should be sold/divided equally it would save time and money

attributes.action: Compulsory dyslexia tests in schools
attributes.background: At the moment there aren't compulsory tests for dyslexia in primary schools so thousands of children struggle through their school life without knowing that they have it. This needs to change so that they can receive support and advice to help them.
